intro: Notelaea laurifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved kōhanga, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It is a small tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Notelaea laurifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
